metadata.title: CVE-2021-3420 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in newlib in versions prior to 4.0.0. Improper overflowvalidation in the memory allocation functions mEMALIGn, pvALLOc,nano_memalign, nano_valloc, nano_pvalloc could case an integer overflow,leading to an allocation of a small buffer and then to a heap-based bufferoverflow.

criterions.comment: newlib: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
gcc-snapshot: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
